001package imagingbook.lib.image;
002
003import java.awt.BasicStroke;
004import java.awt.Color;
005import java.awt.Graphics2D;
006import java.awt.Graphics;
007import java.awt.RenderingHints;
008import java.awt.Shape;
009import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
010import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
011import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
012import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
013import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
014import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
015
016import ij.process.Blitter;
017import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
018import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
021import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
022
023/**
024 * <p>This class defines functionality for drawing anti-aliased
025 * graphics on top of images of type 
026 * {@link ByteProcessor},
027 * {@link ShortProcessor} or
028 * {@link ColorProcessor}
029 * (there is no support for {@link FloatProcessor}).
030 * It uses the capabilities of AWT's {@link Graphics2D} class
031 * by drawing to a {@link BufferedImage}, which is a copy of
032 * the original image. After performing the drawing operations
033 * the {@link BufferedImage} is copied back to the original.
034 * Thus all operations possible on a {@link Graphics2D} instance
035 * are available, including the drawing of {@link Shape}
036 * objects with floating-point coordinates, arbitrary 
037 * strokes and anti-aliasing, which is not available with
038 * ImageJ's built-in graphics operations (for class {@link ImageProcessor}).
039 * </p>
040 * <p>
041 * Since drawing involves copying the image multiple times, graphic operations
042 * should be grouped for efficiency reasons.
043 * Here is an example for the intended form of use:
044 * </p>
045 * <pre>
046 * ImageProcessor ip = ... ;   // some ByteProcessor, ShortProcessor or ColorProcessor
047 * try (ImageGraphics g = new ImageGraphics(ip)) {
048 *      g.setColor(255);
049 *      g.setLineWidth(1.0);
050 *      g.drawLine(40, 100.5, 250, 101.5);
051 *      g.drawOval(230.6, 165.2, 150, 150);
052 *      ...
053 * }</pre>
054 * <p>
055 * Note the use of <code>double</code> coordinates throughout.
056 * The original image ({@code ip} in the above example) is automatically updated 
057 * at the end of the {@code try() ...} clause (by {@link ImageGraphics} implementing the
058 * {@link AutoCloseable} interface).
059 * The {@link #getGraphics()} method exposes the underlying 
060 * {@link Graphics2D} instance of the {@link ImageGraphics} object, which can then be used to
061 * perform arbitrary graphic operations.
062 * Thus, the above example can be <strong>alternatively</strong> implemented
063 * as followings:
064 * <pre>
065 * ImageProcessor ip = ... ;   // some ByteProcessor, ShortProcessor or ColorProcessor
066 * try (ImageGraphics g = new ImageGraphics(ip)) {
067 *      Graphics2D g2 = g.getGraphics();
068 *      g2.setColor(Color.white);
069 *      g2.setStroke(new BasicStroke(1.0f));
070 *      g2.draw(new Line2D.Double(40, 100.5, 250, 101.5));
071 *      g2.draw(new Ellipse2D.Double(230.6, 165.2, 150, 150));
072 *      ...
073 * }</pre>
074 * <p>
075 * This class also defines several convenience methods for drawing
076 * shapes with floating-point ({@code double}) coordinates, as well as for
077 * setting colors and stroke parameters.
078 * If intermediate updates are needed (e.g., for animations), the {@code update()} method
079 * can be invoked any time.
080 * The plugin {@code Geometric_Operations.Draw_Test_Grid} in the
081 * <a href="https://github.com/imagingbook/imagingbook-plugins-all/tree/master">
082 * imagingbook-plugins-all</a> repository shows a complete example.
083 * </p>
084 * 
085 * @author W. Burger
086 * @version 2020-01-07
087 */
088public class ImageGraphics implements AutoCloseable {
089        
090        private static BasicStroke DEFAULT_STROKE = new BasicStroke();
091        private static Color DEFAULT_COLOR = Color.white;
092        private static boolean DEFAULT_ANTIALIASING = true;
093        
094        private ImageProcessor ip;
095        private BufferedImage bi;
096        private final Graphics2D g;
097        
098        private BasicStroke stroke = DEFAULT_STROKE;
099        private Color color = DEFAULT_COLOR;
100        
101        // -------------------------------------------------------------
102        
103        /**
104         * Constructor. The supplied image must be of type
105         * {@link ByteProcessor}, {@link ShortProcessor} or 
106         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
107         * An {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown for images
108         * of type {@link FloatProcessor}.
109         * 
110         * @param ip image to draw on
111         */
112        public ImageGraphics(ImageProcessor ip) {
113                this(ip, null, null);
114        }
115        
116        /**
117         * Constructor. The supplied image must be of type
118         * {@link ByteProcessor}, {@link ShortProcessor} or 
119         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
120         * An {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown for images
121         * of type {@link FloatProcessor}.
122         * 
123         * @param ip image to draw on
124         * @param color the initial drawing color
125         * @param stroke the initial stroke
126         */
127        public ImageGraphics(ImageProcessor ip, Color color, BasicStroke stroke) {
128                this.ip = ip;
129                this.bi = toBufferedImage(ip);
130                
131                if (color != null) this.color = color;
132                if (stroke != null) this.stroke = stroke;
133                
134                this.g = (Graphics2D) bi.getGraphics();
135                this.g.setColor(color);
136                this.g.setColor(this.color);
137                this.g.setStroke(this.stroke);
138                this.setAntialiasing(DEFAULT_ANTIALIASING);
139        }
140        
141        public void setAntialiasing(boolean on) {
142                g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, on ? 
143                                RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON : RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_OFF);
144                g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING, on ?
145                                RenderingHints.VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_ON : RenderingHints.VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_OFF);
146        }
147        
148        /**
149         * Returns the underlying {@link Graphics2D} object,
150         * which can be used to perform arbitrary graphics operations.
151         * @return the {@link Graphics2D} object
152         */
153        public Graphics2D getGraphics() {
154                return this.g;
155        }
156        
157        /**
158         * Forces the image to be updated by copying the (modified)
159         * {@link BufferedImage} back to the input image.
160         * There is usually no need to call this (expensive) method explicitly.
161         * It is called automatically and only once at end of the 
162         * {@code try() ...} clause, as described in the {@link ImageGraphics}
163         * class documentation above.
164         */
165        public void update() {
166                copyImageToProcessor(bi, ip);
167        }
168
169        @Override
170        public void close() {
171                update();
172                ip = null;
173                bi = null;
174        }
175        
176        // -----------------------------------------------------------
177        
178        // Needed, since IJ's conversion methods are not named consistently.
179        private BufferedImage toBufferedImage(ImageProcessor ip) {
180                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor) {
181                        return ((ByteProcessor) ip).getBufferedImage(); 
182                }
183                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor) {
184                        return ((ShortProcessor) ip).get16BitBufferedImage(); 
185                }
186                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
187                        return ((ColorProcessor) ip).getBufferedImage();
188                }
189                else {
190                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot create BufferedImage from " +
191                                        ip.getClass().getName());
192                }
193        }
194        
195        /**
196         * Copies the contents of the {@link BufferedImage} to the specified 
197         * {@link ImageProcessor}. The size and type of the BufferedImage
198         * is assumed to match the ImageProcessor.
199         * 
200         * @param bi the local (intermediate) {@link BufferedImage} instance
201         * @param ip the original {@link ImageProcessor}
202         */
203        private void copyImageToProcessor(BufferedImage bi, ImageProcessor ip) {
204                ImageProcessor ip2 = null;
205                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor) {
206                        ip2 = new ByteProcessor(bi); 
207                }
208                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor) {
209                        ip2 = new ShortProcessor(bi); 
210                }
211                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
212                        ip2 = new ColorProcessor(bi); 
213                }
214                else {
215                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot create BufferedImage from " +
216                                        ip.getClass().getName());
217                }
218                ip.copyBits(ip2, 0, 0, Blitter.COPY);
219        }
220        
221        // -----------------------------------------------------------
222        //  Convenience methods for drawing selected shapes with double coordinates
223        // -----------------------------------------------------------
224        
225        /**
226         * Convenience method. Draws a straight line segment specified with
227         * {@code double} coordinate values.
228         * @param x1 x-coordinate of start point
229         * @param y1 y-coordinate of start point
230         * @param x2 x-coordinate of end point
231         * @param y2 y-coordinate of end point
232         * @see Line2D
233         */
234        public void drawLine(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2) {
235                g.draw(new Line2D.Double(x1, y1, x2, y2));
236        }
237        
238        /**
239         * Convenience method. Draws an ellipse specified with
240         * {@code double} coordinate values.
241         * @param x x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle
242         * @param y y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle
243         * @param w width
244         * @param h height
245         * @see Ellipse2D
246         */
247        public void drawOval(double x, double y, double w, double h) {
248                g.draw(new Ellipse2D.Double(x, y, w, h));
249        }
250        
251        /**
252         * Convenience method. Draws a rectangle specified with
253         * {@code double} coordinate values.
254         * @param x x-coordinate of the upper-left corner
255         * @param y y-coordinate of the upper-left corner
256         * @param w width
257         * @param h height
258         * @see Rectangle2D
259         */
260        public void drawRectangle(double x, double y, double w, double h) {
261                g.draw(new Rectangle2D.Double(x, y, w, h));
262        }
263        
264        /**
265         * Convenience method. Draws a closed polygon specified by a 
266         * sequence of {@link Point2D} objects (with arbitrary coordinate values).
267         * Note that the the polygon is automatically closed, i.e.,
268         * N+1 segments are drawn if the number of given points is N.
269         * @param points a sequence of 2D points
270         * @see Path2D
271         */
272        public void drawPolygon(Point2D ... points) {
273                Path2D.Double p = new Path2D.Double();
274                p.moveTo(points[0].getX(), points[0].getY());
275                for (int i = 1; i < points.length; i++) {
276                        p.lineTo(points[i].getX(), points[i].getY());
277                }
278                p.closePath();
279                g.draw(p);
280        }
281        
282        // stroke-related methods -------------------------------------
283        
284        /**
285         * Sets this graphics context's current color to the specified color. 
286         * All subsequent graphics operations using this graphics context use 
287         * this specified color.
288         * @param color the new rendering color
289         * @see Graphics#setColor
290         */
291        public void setColor(Color color) {
292                this.color = color;
293                g.setColor(color);
294        }
295        
296        /**
297         * Sets this graphics context's current color to the specified
298         * (gray) color, with RGB = (gray, gray, gray).
299         * @param gray the gray value
300         */
301        public void setColor(int gray) {
302                if (gray < 0) gray = 0;
303                if (gray > 255) gray = 255;
304                this.setColor(new Color(gray, gray, gray));
305        }
306        
307        /**
308         * Sets the stroke to be used for all subsequent graphics operations.
309         * @param stroke a {@link BasicStroke} instance
310         * @see BasicStroke
311         */
312        public void setStroke(BasicStroke stroke) {
313                this.stroke = stroke;
314                g.setStroke(this.stroke);
315        }
316        
317        /**
318         * Sets the line width of the current stroke.
319         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
320         * @param width the line width
321         * @see BasicStroke
322         */
323        public void setLineWidth(double width) {
324                this.stroke = new BasicStroke((float)width, stroke.getEndCap(), stroke.getLineJoin());
325                g.setStroke(this.stroke);
326        }
327        
328        /**
329         * Sets the end cap style of the current stroke to "BUTT".
330         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
331         * @see BasicStroke
332         */
333        public void setEndCapButt() {
334                this.setEndCap(BasicStroke.CAP_BUTT);
335        }
336        
337        /**
338         * Sets the end cap style of the current stroke to "ROUND".
339         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
340         * @see BasicStroke
341         */
342        public void setEndCapRound() {
343                this.setEndCap(BasicStroke.CAP_ROUND);
344        }
345        
346        /**
347         * Sets the end cap style of the current stroke to "SQUARE".
348         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
349         * @see BasicStroke
350         */
351        public void setEndCapSquare() {
352                this.setEndCap(BasicStroke.CAP_SQUARE);
353        }
354        
355        private void setEndCap(int cap) {
356                setStroke(new BasicStroke(stroke.getLineWidth(), cap, stroke.getLineJoin()));
357        }
358        
359        // ---------------------
360        
361        /**
362         * Sets the line segment join style of the current stroke to "BEVEL".
363         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
364         * @see BasicStroke
365         */
366        public void setLineJoinBevel() {
367                setLineJoin(BasicStroke.JOIN_BEVEL);
368        }
369        
370        /**
371         * Sets the line segment join style of the current stroke to "MITER".
372         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
373         * @see BasicStroke
374         */
375        public void setLineJoinMiter() {
376                setLineJoin(BasicStroke.JOIN_MITER);
377        }
378        
379        /**
380         * Sets the line segment join style of the current stroke to "ROUND".
381         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
382         * @see BasicStroke
383         */
384        public void setLineJoinRound() {
385                setLineJoin(BasicStroke.JOIN_ROUND);
386        }
387        
388        private void setLineJoin(int join) {
389                setStroke(new BasicStroke(stroke.getLineWidth(), stroke.getEndCap(), join));
390        }
391}
